intro: Cerbera platyspermos, commonly known as the broad-fruited cerbera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds, and it is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its toxic sap and seeds, it is considered a hazardous plant to handle without proper precautions.
